page.title: 08Transport in Saxilby Area
page.content: Saxilby is almost self-contained, but the railway station brings London or Scotland quickly within reach. Locally , it is faster to travel to Lincoln or Gainsborough by train than bus, since only a few buses use the A57 trunk road. They pick up from villages like Skellingthorpe, making the route appear tortuous. There are no Sunday buses and the last evening bus leaves Lincoln at 5.40pm taking 23 minutes along the main road. In contrast the last train leaves Lincoln at 10.30pm and there is a restricted Sunday service. There are school buses, a shopping bus to Tesco in Lincoln plus a private firm operating to Lincoln on Fridays and Saturdays. Coach outings are popularand there are 2 taxi firms. Bicycles are useful, but a car becomes essential in the more rural areas. Broxholme has no bus service now.
